About

Here is a little background

Hey there, I'm Tanner. Nice to meet you. Here's a little bit about me. I'm a Developer out of Portland OR. I studied Philosophy, Chinese, and Japanese at Lewis and Clark College but only recently fell in love with programming. After running small businesses throughout much of my twenties I've now put my logic and language skills to use for the duration of 2022 in grinding to become an awesome Developer. I love few things more than complex problem solving though I also enjoy communicating those complex technical challenges into less technical and more comprehensible English. This came in handy after Hack Reactor decided to keep me on after graduation as an Engineer in Residence to help mentor the class that followed mine. I'm already excited to take a look at your projects so keep scrolling down to find a contact form and lets chat!

Projects

Case Study 1 of 3: Fintech FrontEnd Practice

Proof of concept for a FinTech landing page. This is a case study in taking Figma design and translating it to a professional, deployed front facing app. This extra text is for checking overflow scroll behaviour and can be ignored if found on your screen because the production backend will be up shortly.

Case Study 2 of 3: Making Mike Sad

This was a long term project at HackReactor aimed at making my good buddy, Mike Zaki, sad. I'd call this one successful for the duration of the course but he seems pretty steadfastly positive now that he's back to the real world. Kidding, this is ofc, more filler so I can make this scroll behavior is working.

Case Study 3 of 3: Andrew Demo

This is a demo of how the array mapping works for a friend I'm helping in his software journey. Currently I'm in the process of deploying the rest of my projects to make this section link directly to them. In the meantime this is a placeholder for texting reactivity across screen sizes.
